title: Falua 2012 Conde de Vimioso Extra Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)
description: A creamy blend of Touriga Nacional and Chardonnay to give a fruity wine with melon and spice flavors as well as light acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Leconfield NV SYN Rouge Shiraz (Coonawarra)
description: This is a rich, heady wine offering Shiraz's notorious trio of ripe plum, chocolate and peppery spice. The palate feels heavy and a little syrupy sweet. The light fizz and tannic edge do little to lift the palate.

title: Lorimar 2015 Red (California)
description: Blatant oak aromas and flavors dominate whatever fruit flavors might lie underneath. It smells sweet and spicy, tastes spicy and has moderate tannins and high alcohol.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Rosé (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a fruity, soft-textured and sweet wine with cherry and raspberry flavors. The mouthfeel is rich and plush and the acidity is quite low.

title: Paul Buisse 2017 Domaine Paul Buisse Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: For a Touraine Sauvignon, this is rich and ripe with tropical fruits as well as the necessary acidity. It is fruity, with a lightly zesty texture and a soft aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Trentadue 2016 Old Patch Red (California)
description: This wine is very fruity, smooth and polished, showing light oaky touches on ripe plum and black-cherry flavors that finish on the sweet side. The texture is soft and acidity feels low.

title: Vite Colte 2017 Merlana  (Erbaluce di Caluso)
description: Lightly scented, this informal white offers aromas evoking beeswax and a whiff of field flower. The simple palate suggests yellow pear and apple before a fresh finish.

title: Cruzat NV Cuvée Nature  (Uco Valley)
description: Yeasty aromas of lemon and apple are solid enough. This sparkler is fairly mellow in feel, with modest grip and acidity. Bready, slightly briny apple flavors settle on a mild finish that some might say is lacking.

title: Bedell 2016 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Quiet tones of white flowers and citrus carry the nose and palate. This is a simple, straightforward white that would appeal to those looking for a light, crisp refresher.

title: Chopo 2016 Red (Jumilla)
description: Heavy berry aromas give way to scented soap and cola notes. This blend of 80% Monastrell and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon is quite heavy, with a syrupy mouthfeel cut by rough acidity. Black-fruit flavors lack flow on a flush but stunted finish.

title: Cruzat NV Brut Rosé Méthodo Tradicional  (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Bland, harmless aromas are a touch soapy and sweet but don't signal anything in particular. A basic palate is plump, while generic flavors are much like the nose, meaning simple and lacking in definition.

title: D'Arenberg 2014 The Custodian Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: Considering Grenache's soft and cuddly reputation, this rendition is rather hard-edged. The variety's characteristic ripe berry and white pepper combo is there, accompanied by a little meat and flower stalks, but there's an unexpected bite to the acidity, that, when combined with the tight, drying tannins, make taking another sip a challenge.

title: Flegenheimer Bros. NV Out of the Park Sparkling Shiraz (South Australia)
description: This sparkler shows off luscious characters of ripe plum, raspberry jam, cherry, chocolate cake and coffee. It's sweet and fairly syrupy in feel, with ample bubbles and soft tannins.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This light, fruity and herbal wine shows a good balance between citrus and gooseberry fruits and a bright, fresh character. Drink this simple wine now.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Petit Bourgeois Cabernet Franc (Val de Loire)
description: This simple, perfumed wine has attractive red fruits to go with its barnyard character and light acidity. Soft with just a hint of tannins, it has a fruity finish. Drink now.

title: Kenwood 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Creamy thick with a candied midpalate of watermelon Jolly Rancher and strawberry jam, this has elements of dried herb and jalapeño.

title: Magister Bibendi 2014 Navarrsotillo Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Baked, earthy berry aromas are cooked and nutty, not fresh. A palate with heft is awkward and a bit out of balance, while this Garnacha tastes of roasted berry fruits and burnt wood. Lingering oak spice is the most notable flavor on a heavy finish.

title: Maryhill 2017 Tudor Hills Vineyards Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)
description: Ripe peach and apple aromas are out front, followed by whiffs of tropical fruit. The palate brings dried apple flavors with a lightly smoky finish.

title: Settesoli 2017 Pinot Grigio (Terre Siciliane)
description: Lightly scented, this informal, light-bodied white opens with whiffs of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The fresh, simple palate suggests white peach and a hint of citrus rind.

title: Spann Vineyards 2014 S & M Syrah-Malbec (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 67% Syrah with 33% Malbec to powerful effect. The wine is thick in nondescript red berry and blueberry notes and oaky tannin.
